name: NCI Proteomics Data Commons
description: The objectives of the National Cancer Institute’s Proteomics Data Commons (PDC) are (1) to make cancer-related proteomic datasets easily accessible to the public, and (2) facilitate direct multiomics integration in support of precision medicine through interoperability with accompanying data resources (genomic and medical image datasets).
use_cases: Access to highly curated and standardized biospecimen, clinical and proteomic data
Intuitive interface to filter, query, search, visualize and download data and metadata
Common data harmonization pipeline for uniform analysis of all PDC data and advanced visualization
Cloud-based (Amazon Web Services) infrastructure for interoperability with AWS based tools and platforms
API for cloud-agnostic data access and functionality extension by third parties
Structured workspace for private user data store and data submission portal
Distribution of controlled access data with dbGaP authorization and eRA Commons authentication
